update.description:
* Add non-blocking versions of the functions in IntrospectionClient.
* Add some tests.
* Add a mutex to IntrospectionClient.
* Unlock the mutex in IntrospectionManager when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the registered items.

~~~It requires [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/112) from Ignition Transport.~~~
update.title: Introspection service - part6 (final tweaks)

content.raw: Thanks, merged 6aa3a80
content.html: Thanks, merged 6aa3a80

update.description:
* Add non-blocking versions of the functions in IntrospectionClient.
* Add some tests.
* Add a mutex to IntrospectionClient.
* Unlock the mutex in IntrospectionManager when we execute the callbacks for updating the values of the registered items.

It requires [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/pull-requests/112) from Ignition Transport.
update.title: Introspection service - part6 (final tweaks)

content.raw: I see, let's put a comment at least so anyone can understand the difficulty of avoiding a copy and maybe propose a solution
content.html: I see, let's put a comment at least so anyone can understand the difficulty of avoiding a copy and maybe propose a solution

content.raw: I don't want to keep a mutex while calling a user callback as that might lead to a deadlock. Agreed that copy has some performance impact but I didn't find a more creative solution.
content.html: I don't want to keep a mutex while calling a user callback as that might lead to a deadlock. Agreed that copy has some performance impact but I didn't find a more creative solution.

content.raw: Moved to a private function in 847020d
content.html: Moved to a private function in 847020d

content.raw: I assume that we are making a copy here not to block the iteration some lines below. If we can avoid unnecessary copies of std containers, better. I'm not sure if the lock on iterations would be worse than the copies.

content.raw: could we add the service string in the error line?
content.html: could we add the service string in the error line?

content.raw: check that _newItems is not empty? or we allow it to be empty?
content.html: check that _newItems is not empty? or we allow it to be empty?

content.raw: if we should unconditionally and otherwise impossible from our logic, then maybe assert fits better. If it could be the case but undesirable, maybe we can add an error message somehow.
content.html: if we should unconditionally and otherwise impossible from our logic, then maybe assert fits better. If it could be the case but undesirable, maybe we can add an error message somehow.

content.raw: This new c++11 constructions sometimes are not trivial to read or we are not yet used to. Maybe a quick comment would help at least until we all get familiars with them.
content.html: This new c++11 constructions sometimes are not trivial to read or we are not yet used to. Maybe a quick comment would help at least until we all get familiars with them.

content.raw: we probably want to check _newItems for non empty, since the documentation of the function clearly indicate it and we are not controlling the effect of the empty set.
content.html: we probably want to check _newItems for non empty, since the documentation of the function clearly indicate it and we are not controlling the effect of the empty set.

content.raw: Needed for plotting. This is currently used by the `plot_p4` branch which makes  async IntrospectionClient service calls to get item list and update filters.
content.html: Needed for plotting. This is currently used by the plot_p4 branch which makes async IntrospectionClient service calls to get item list and update filters.
